main event: A sighting of a disc was reported in the Santiago area, San Bernardo and Valparaiso, Chile on the 24th and 25th of March 1950.
interesting points: The sighting was part of a larger series of disc sightings reported across various parts of Chile., The first sighting was reported in Punta Arenas on 11 March 1950., The usual description given by witnesses was a silver-colored, disc-shaped object observed at extreme altitude., A major from the USAF concluded that a stationary object seen later was actually the planet Venus., The sightings received considerable media attention including local press coverage.
witness description: no specific witnesses reported in the document
